metadata.dc:author: Garrón Aoiz, L
Sebastián Borruel, J L
Montesino Semper, M
Jiménez Calvo, J
Millán Serrano, J A
Idígora Planas, X
Santiago González de Garibay, A M
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVES To evaluate the efficacy of surgical treatment of angiomyolipoma. METHODS We present a case of multiple, bilateral renal angiomyolipoma in a patient with tuberous sclerosis, who was treated by conservative surgery. RESULTS The patient is clinically asymptomatic one year after surgery and both kidneys are functioning correctly as shown by pyelography. CONCLUSIONS We recommend conservative surgical treatment of symptomatic or developing angiomyolipomas.
metadata.dc:title: Angiomiolipomas renales bilaterales asociados a la esclerosis tuberosa: tratamiento quirúrgico conservador.
[Bilateral renal angiomyolipoma associated with tuberous sclerosis: conservative surgical treatment].
